document.masterDocTitle: The return of a forgotten harvestman: revalidation of Gonyleptes robustus Holmberg, 1876, as the second species of Acanthopachylus Roewer, 1913 (Arachnida, Opiliones, Gonyleptidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The return of a forgotten harvestman: revalidation of Gonyleptes robustus Holmberg, 1876, as the second species of Acanthopachylus Roewer, 1913 (Arachnida, Opiliones, Gonyleptidae)

heading.emphasis:
Acanthopachylus robustus ( Holmberg, 1876 )
comb. nov. , revalidated

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Gonyleptes robustus Holmberg 1876: 29
. Type : one male , “near Palermo, Collection of the author”, lost.

Pachylus mesopotamogalis Weyenbergh 1878: 316
. Types : ♂ ♀ lost. Syn. nov. (formerly under
A. aculeatus : Ringuelet 1959
).

Pachylus aculeatus : Sørensen 1884: 641
(in part) [=
Gonyleptes robustus
, synonymy incorrect].

subSubSection.paragraph:
Acanthpachylus aculeatus : Roewer 1913
(in part): 51; figs. 19, 20 are
A. robustus
comb. nov.

Acanthopachylus aculeatus : Roewer 1923
(in part): 412, figs. 507, 508 (drawings are
A. robustus
comb. nov.
, but materials are mixed); B. Soares & H. Soares 1954: 233 (in part.); Ringuelet 1953 (in part): 161 [=
Heteropachyloidellus serrulatus
]; 1955 (in part): 283–288 [=
Heteropachyloidellus dimorphicus
=
H. paucigranulatus
=
H. marginatus = Pachyloidellus tricalcaratus
=
Pachyloidellus fuscus
, the latter synonym of
Pachyloidellus butleri : Acosta 1993
, =
H. robustus
, actually referable to
A. aculeatus
comb. nov.
]; 1959 (in part): 275 [=
Pachylus mesopotamogalis
, actually refers to
A. robustus
comb. nov.
] [all illustrations depict
A. robustus
comb. nov.
]; H. Soares & B. Soares 1986: 87 , figs. 1, 2 (in part) [=
Guascaia ypsilonota
]; Acosta & Maury 1998: 580 ; Acosta 2002: 81 (new material of
A. robustus
comb. nov.
cited as
A. aculeatus
); Kury 2003: 154 (in part).

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Pachyloidellus tricalcaratus Roewer 1923: 448
, fig. 564 [ Types : SMF, ♀ Buenos Aires , examined]. Syn. nov. (formerly under
A. aculeatus : Ringuelet 1955
).

Heteropachyloidellus dimorphicus Mello-Leitão, 1927: 15
[ Types : MNRJ, ♂ ♀ probably Rio Grande do Sul , examined]. Syn. nov. (formerly under
A. aculeatus : Ringuelet 1955
).

Heteropachyloidellus paucigranulatus Mello-Leitão, 1931: 88
[ Types : MACN, MNRJ, ♂ ♀ Carmelo, Uruguay , examined]. Syn. nov. (formerly under
A. aculeatus : Ringuelet 1955
).

Heteropachyloidellus serrulatus Mello-Leitão, 1931: 88
, fig. 5 [ Types : MACN, MNRJ, ♂ ♀ Entre Ríos , examined]. Syn. nov. (formerly under
A. aculeatus : Ringuelet 1953
).

Heteropachyloidellus marginatus Mello-Leitão, 1932: 150
[ Type : MNRJ, ♀ Rio Grande do Sul , examined]. Syn. nov. (formerly under
A. aculeatus : Ringuelet 1955
).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Guascaia ypsilonata
vel
ypsilonota Mello-Leitão, 1935a: 1
, 3, fig. 1 [ Types : MNRJ, ♂ ♀ Porto Alegre, Rio Grande do Sul , examined—two original spellings,
ypsilonota
selected by Mello-Leitão, 1935b: 101 , acting as first reviser: ICZN Art. 24.2.4.]. Syn. nov. (formerly under
A. aculeatus : H. Soares & B. Soares, 1986
).

Identification. Holmberg’s (1876) description contains unequivocal hints of the identity of this species, very especially the strong S-curvature of femur IV ( Figs. 1D , 2D ), and the basal truncated apophysis in the same leg segment ( Fig. 2C ). The locality “near Palermo”, now embraced within the urban area of Buenos Aires city, is fully consistent with the known distribution of
A. robustus
comb. nov.

Type locality.
Buenos Aires , near Palermo , Argentina
.

Distribution. Widespread in Argentina (provinces Buenos Aires , La Pampa , Córdoba , Santa Fe , Entre Ríos , Corrientes and Misiones ), Uruguay (Departamentos Colonia , Rio Negro , Paysandú , Rivera , Cerro Largo , Treinta y Tres ) and southern Brazil ( Rio Grande do Sul State ) ( Fig. 3 ).
